instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6903: What is U6903? This chip is responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H in 2016-2018 model Macbook logic boards.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at loadingscreen
threads.message:
Hi there,
got a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - did get it with some corrosion around <CHIP>U6903</CHIP> (see picture) and at the Touch ID. After restoring it with Apple Configurator 2 it stucks (after the internet recovery screen) at this state. Already tried to restore it again - same result. Tried another touch ID, but still the same behavior? Fan behaves normally.
Any ideas what could be the problem here? Faulty CPU?
I'm not able to boot into the boot options menu or performing NVRAM reset - always directly boots into internet recovery mode. Keyboard is working since I'm able to type in my wifi password for internet connection.

[ATTACH type="full"]59876[/ATTACH]
[ATTACH type="full"]59877[/ATTACH][ATTACH type="full"]59878[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck at loadingscreen
threads.message:
Corrosion on the backlight output rail; that is very bad.
Leakage from high voltage to some data lines could damaged CPU, or T2.
